abstract: French vessel Charles de Gaulle becomes first non-American ship to take command of CTF-50, military campaign tasked with conducting airstrikes against Islamic State; nuclear powered aircraft carrier was deployed days after Paris November terrorist attacks and is also intended to keep Iranians, who signed nuclear restriction treaty, in check.
lead_paragraph: The Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris cast a spotlight on the carrier, which left its home port just five days later. Its deployment, however, had long been planned.

headline.main: French Ship Commands Naval Task Force in Strikes Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: At Battle Against ISIS, but With French Touch

snippet: The Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris cast a spotlight on the carrier, which left its home port just five days later. Its deployment, however, had long been planned.
